results.title: Ouyen's Roxy Theatre
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Roxy Theatre in Ouyen was under threat of becoming an abandoned ruin until the community stepped in to save it. Originally opened in 1936, it eventually became one of the only tropical theatres in the southern region of Australia but was closed in 1971 due to the actions of rowdy youths (according to local myth). After 36 years of closure, Jenny Heaslip took on the challenge of restoring the theatre and rallied over 250 local volunteers to help her. It is now an integral meeting point for the people of Ouyen not only because of fortnightly film screenings, but for community events, launches and celebrations. Run on a shoestring budget The Roxy continues to rely upon volunteers and community fundraising to stay alive.

results.title: Outward bound to adventure
results.brief_description: The Outward Bound School in Malaya. Boys aged between 15 and 25 years are given valuable character training through planned outdoor activities which call primarily for physical fitness, self-reliance, initiative and teamwork. The film shows how Kim Seng, a young Malayan factory worker, benefits from a course at the school.

results.title: Outward bound girls' scheme
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto, Scheppes and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “New Horizons”.
The aims and activities of the ‘Outward Bound’ girls’ residential course at Rhewniar in the rugged country of mid-west Wales. Shows the arrival of a new course and the girls being introduced to the accommodation and facilities. Includes fitness training, tuition in camp craft, canoe construction, rope work, home nursing, drama and self expression. The girls are seen accepting the ever increasing challenge of mountains, rivers and open waters in progressive expeditions. Photographed by Alan Masters, edited by Stella Smallwood, music by Denis Moonan, commentary by Richard Baker.

results.title: Outward Bound - Willing and Able
results.brief_description: Part 1(a) “Willing and Able”. Outward Bound Australia conducts adventure based personal development programs combining able-bodied and physically disabled people. For those who choose an adventure, such as the one conducted on the Snowy River, there are rewards in addition to experiencing the uniqueness of the Australian wilderness. Part 1(b) “Other Courses”. An exciting overview of all Outward Bound programs. Part 2: Interview with the Executive Director.

results.title: Outward Bound - the Challenge
results.brief_description: Part 1(a) “The Challenge”. Two participants are followed through the 26 day Outward Bound Standard Course. They experience caving, expeditioning, rock climbing, rafting, canoeing, group tasks, navigation, abseiling, exploration and self discovery. Both the challenge and the personal development changes they encounter during this adventure into self-understanding are skilfully captured on film. Part 1(b) “Other Courses”. An exciting overview of all Outward Bound programs. Part 2: Interview with the Executive Director.

results.title: Outward bound
results.brief_description: Describes courses at the two “Outward Bound” schools where boys from all walks of life are provided with character training. At Aberdovey on the coast of Wales, four weeks training is given to young boys bound for the Merchant Navy. At the school in Eskdale, Cumberland, special attention is given to the skills necessary in mountain climbing and life-saving.

results.title: Outward bound
results.brief_description: This film follows a group of six young men on the 99th Outward Bound Course. The dialogue conveys their thoughts and feelings as they take part in rock-climbing, canoeing, caving, cross-country running, and camping. Shows the different reactions of the group to the challenge of survival in these conditions. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Outward bound
results.creator_credit: Joern Gerdts, Robert Fulton, Roger C. Brown, Barry Corbet, Crystal Productions and Summit Films
results.brief_description: The benefits of the outward bound course, including increased autonomy and knowledge of people, and the psychological kick to be had from danger. Good photography and much use of music. This is not an instructional film.

results.title: Outward bound
results.creator_credit: Roger Mills, Clem Vallance and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Around the world in 80 days”.
In this the first half of his journey, Michael Palin travels from London to Madras, via Venice, Alexandria, Saudi Arabia, Dubai and Bombay. Dropping further and further behind schedule Palin struggles with missed connections, bureaucratic negotiations and seasickness until, after a quick shave by a blind man with a cut-throat blade, he boards the train to Madras, only to find his seat has been given to three different Michael Palins, one of them a woman!
